message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of fair allocation of indivisible items among agents with additive valuations, which is a classic problem in game theory (cs.GT) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The focus on envy-freeness up to any item (EFX) as a fairness concept suggests a connection to algorithmic mechanism design (cs.DS) and social choice theory (cs.DM). Finally, the use of algorithmic techniques and analysis of welfare suggest a connection to machine learning (cs.LG).
